title: Crying baby disrupts Emma Raducanu during Aryna Sabalenka epic
description: At a crucial juncture of the match, the British No 1 had to keep her focus amid an unusual crowd disturbance
content:
Emma Raducanu took issue with a crying baby during her three-hour epic against world No 1 Aryna Sabalenka at the Cincinnati Open.

In a chaotic eighth game of the deciding final set, as the match ebbed and flowed in every direction, Raducanu was distracted by a baby as she struggled to hold serve.

Fresh off their third-round clash at Wimbledon last month, Sabalenka and Raducanu produced another fine contest, featuring a 13-deuce game in the third set, before the 27-year-old Belarusian sealed victory in three hours and nine minutes.

Telegraph Sport takes you through some of those key moments ...

Raducanu, who served impressively all match, moved to 40-15 when she hit a first serve down the T and finished off the short return with a backhand winner.

Little did we know that this would be the start of a titanic service game.

Sabalenka keeps herself in the game and makes it deuce. She earns her first break point when Raducanu slices a backhand into the net.

Raducanu responds to that error with a first serve ace down the T. Clutch play at a critical time.

Raducanu and crowd want baby removed from stadium

After squandering her sixth opportunity to hold serve, Raducanu goes to the back of the court and says: “It’s been like 10 minutes.”

Umpire: “It’s a child. Do you want me to send the child out of the stadium?”

Raducanu doesn’t even have to reply because the spectators around her do so, saying “Yeah.”

Raducanu smiles, wipes her shoulder with a towel and prepares to go again.

Why a baby is at a tennis match is another question ...
summary: Emma Raducanu was distracted by a crying baby during her three-hour match against world No 1 Aryna Sabalenka at the Cincinnati Open. The match ended in a 13-deuce game in the third set, with Sabalenko securing victory in three hours and nine minutes. Raducanus was unable to hold serve during a crucial eighth game of the final set and asked the referee to remove the child from the stadium.
shortSummary: Emma Raducanu criticized a crying baby during her epic match against Aryna Sabalenka at the Cincinnati Open, prompting calls for the child's removal.
argos_summary: During her match against Aryna Sabalenka at the Cincinnati Open, Emma Raducanu expressed frustration over a crying baby distracting her during a crucial service game. The match was intense, lasting over three hours, and included a dramatic 13-deuce game in the final set. Raducanu's request for the baby to be removed was supported by the crowd, highlighting the unusual situation of a child at a tennis match.
